questions.text: What is the core intent of keeping housing and services separate?

options.A: To allow services to enforce lease compliance
options.B: To ensure non‑coercive support that does not gatekeep housing
options.D: To enable property staff to supervise service plans

questions.explanation: The policy emphasizes psychological safety and non‑coercive relationships; services must never gatekeep housing.

questions.text: Which task must NOT be performed by a case manager?
questions.explanation: Case managers do not handle rent collection, lease enforcement, or eviction tasks; those are property functions.

questions.text: Tenant engagement in services should be:
questions.explanation: Tenancy is governed by the lease, not by participation in services.

questions.text: Which practice violates required privacy protections?

options.A: Meeting in a neutral private space

questions.explanation: Client units must remain private; monitoring equipment cannot be installed inside.

questions.text: How should housing and service teams coordinate?

options.A: Under shared management to streamline decisions
options.B: Via scheduled, structured communication that maintains distinct roles
options.C: By allowing service staff to approve evictions
options.D: Through joint access to all tenancy records without consent

questions.explanation: Teams coordinate through structured communication while keeping responsibilities distinct.

questions.text: When services are delivered on‑site, they must:

options.C: Preserve privacy and avoid any sense of coercion

questions.explanation: On‑site services should preserve privacy and avoid surveillance or coercion.

questions.text: Why might a case manager attend a lease signing?

options.A: To add service compliance to the lease
options.B: To ensure tenancy isn’t conditioned on services

questions.explanation: Advocacy includes ensuring leases do not tie tenancy to service participation.

questions.text: Which statement best reflects proper role boundaries?

options.A: Property managers deliver case management when short‑staffed
options.B: Service staff may collect rent during crises
options.C: Different entities/staff hold clearly delineated duties
options.D: Either team can lead eviction decisions

questions.explanation: The policy calls for distinct roles held by different entities or clearly separated staff functions.
